page.title: 15The Village Shop Birdingbury
page.content: We visited three shops to compare the services they offered the community. They all had{Post Offices}and the shop keepers were Sub-Postmasters.Each of the shopkeepers said that the shops did not make a profit and depended on the post office section.The post offices are widely used,mainly for the collection of pensions but more recently for the new Girobank service. All the shops carried a vast selection of stock including dairy produce,fresh vegetables,tinned food,tobacco products,stationery and small gifts. The shopkeepers felt they were an important part of the community and acted as a local advertising agency and information office.Unfortunately they all also thought that the village shop would soon be a thing of the past.
